interfaces.core.protocols¶

Source: src\interfaces\core\protocols.py

Module Overview¶

Core protocols and interfaces for communication systems.

This module defines the fundamental protocols that all communication interfaces must implement, providing consistent abstractions for messaging, connections, serialization, and error handling in control systems.

Complete Source Code¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#========================== src/interfaces/core/protocols.py ==========================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Core protocols and interfaces for communication systems.
  7
  8This module defines the fundamental protocols that all communication interfaces
  9must implement, providing consistent abstractions for messaging, connections,
 10serialization, and error handling in control systems.
 11"""
 12
 13from __future__ import annotations
 14
 15from abc import ABC, abstractmethod
 16from typing import Any, Dict, List, Optional, Union, Callable, AsyncIterator, Iterator
 17from dataclasses import dataclass
 18from enum import Enum
 19import time
 20
 21
 22class ConnectionState(Enum):
 23    """Connection state enumeration."""
 24    DISCONNECTED = "disconnected"
 25    CONNECTING = "connecting"
 26    CONNECTED = "connected"
 27    RECONNECTING = "reconnecting"
 28    ERROR = "error"
 29    CLOSED = "closed"
 30
 31
 32class MessageType(Enum):
 33    """Message type enumeration."""
 34    COMMAND = "command"
 35    DATA = "data"
 36    STATUS = "status"
 37    ERROR = "error"
 38    HEARTBEAT = "heartbeat"
 39    ACK = "acknowledgment"
 40    CONFIG = "configuration"
 41
 42
 43class Priority(Enum):
 44    """Message priority levels."""
 45    LOW = 1
 46    NORMAL = 2
 47    HIGH = 3
 48    CRITICAL = 4
 49
 50
 51@dataclass
 52class MessageMetadata:
 53    """Message metadata for tracking and routing."""
 54    message_id: str
 55    timestamp: float
 56    message_type: MessageType
 57    priority: Priority
 58    source: str
 59    destination: Optional[str] = None
 60    correlation_id: Optional[str] = None
 61    retry_count: int = 0
 62    max_retries: int = 3
 63    ttl: Optional[float] = None  # Time to live in seconds
 64
 65
 66class CommunicationProtocol(ABC):
 67    """
 68    Abstract base protocol for all communication interfaces.
 69
 70    This protocol defines the core interface that all communication
 71    systems must implement, providing consistency across different
 72    transport mechanisms.
 73    """
 74
 75    @abstractmethod
 76    async def connect(self, config: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
 77        """
 78        Establish connection with the remote endpoint.
 79
 80        Parameters
 81        ----------
 82        config : Dict[str, Any]
 83            Connection configuration parameters
 84
 85        Returns
 86        -------
 87        bool
 88            True if connection successful, False otherwise
 89        """
 90        pass
 91
 92    @abstractmethod
 93    async def disconnect(self) -> bool:
 94        """
 95        Close connection gracefully.
 96
 97        Returns
 98        -------
 99        bool
100            True if disconnection successful, False otherwise
101        """
102        pass
103
104    @abstractmethod
105    async def send(self, data: Any, metadata: Optional[MessageMetadata] = None) -> bool:
106        """
107        Send data to the remote endpoint.
108
109        Parameters
110        ----------
111        data : Any
112            Data to send
113        metadata : MessageMetadata, optional
114            Message metadata for tracking and routing
115
116        Returns
117        -------
118        bool
119            True if send successful, False otherwise
120        """
121        pass
122
123    @abstractmethod
124    async def receive(self, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[Tuple[Any, MessageMetadata]]:
125        """
126        Receive data from the remote endpoint.
127
128        Parameters
129        ----------
130        timeout : float, optional
131            Timeout in seconds, None for blocking
132
133        Returns
134        -------
135        Tuple[Any, MessageMetadata] or None
136            Received data and metadata, or None if timeout/error
137        """
138        pass
139
140    @abstractmethod
141    def get_connection_state(self) -> ConnectionState:
142        """Get current connection state."""
143        pass
144
145    @abstractmethod
146    def get_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
147        """Get communication statistics."""
148        pass
149
150
151class MessageProtocol(ABC):
152    """
153    Protocol for message handling and routing.
154
155    Defines how messages are processed, routed, and handled
156    within the communication system.
157    """
158
159    @abstractmethod
160    async def process_message(self, data: Any, metadata: MessageMetadata) -> Optional[Any]:
161        """
162        Process incoming message.
163
164        Parameters
165        ----------
166        data : Any
167            Message data
168        metadata : MessageMetadata
169            Message metadata
170
171        Returns
172        -------
173        Any or None
174            Response data or None
175        """
176        pass
177
178    @abstractmethod
179    def register_handler(self, message_type: MessageType, handler: Callable) -> None:
180        """
181        Register message handler for specific message type.
182
183        Parameters
184        ----------
185        message_type : MessageType
186            Type of message to handle
187        handler : Callable
188            Handler function
189        """
190        pass
191
192    @abstractmethod
193    def unregister_handler(self, message_type: MessageType) -> None:
194        """
195        Unregister message handler.
196
197        Parameters
198        ----------
199        message_type : MessageType
200            Type of message to stop handling
201        """
202        pass
203
204    @abstractmethod
205    async def route_message(self, data: Any, metadata: MessageMetadata, destination: str) -> bool:
206        """
207        Route message to specific destination.
208
209        Parameters
210        ----------
211        data : Any
212            Message data
213        metadata : MessageMetadata
214            Message metadata
215        destination : str
216            Target destination
217
218        Returns
219        -------
220        bool
221            True if routing successful
222        """
223        pass
224
225
226class ConnectionProtocol(ABC):
227    """
228    Protocol for connection management.
229
230    Defines connection lifecycle management, including
231    establishment, maintenance, and cleanup.
232    """
233
234    @abstractmethod
235    async def establish_connection(self, endpoint: str, config: Dict[str, Any]) -> str:
236        """
237        Establish new connection.
238
239        Parameters
240        ----------
241        endpoint : str
242            Remote endpoint identifier
243        config : Dict[str, Any]
244            Connection configuration
245
246        Returns
247        -------
248        str
249            Connection identifier
250        """
251        pass
252
253    @abstractmethod
254    async def close_connection(self, connection_id: str) -> bool:
255        """
256        Close specific connection.
257
258        Parameters
259        ----------
260        connection_id : str
261            Connection to close
262
263        Returns
264        -------
265        bool
266            True if successful
267        """
268        pass
269
270    @abstractmethod
271    def get_connection_info(self, connection_id: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
272        """
273        Get connection information.
274
275        Parameters
276        ----------
277        connection_id : str
278            Connection identifier
279
280        Returns
281        -------
282        Dict[str, Any] or None
283            Connection information or None if not found
284        """
285        pass
286
287    @abstractmethod
288    def list_connections(self) -> List[str]:
289        """
290        List all active connections.
291
292        Returns
293        -------
294        List[str]
295            List of connection identifiers
296        """
297        pass
298
299    @abstractmethod
300    async def health_check(self, connection_id: str) -> bool:
301        """
302        Check connection health.
303
304        Parameters
305        ----------
306        connection_id : str
307            Connection to check
308
309        Returns
310        -------
311        bool
312            True if healthy
313        """
314        pass
315
316
317class SerializationProtocol(ABC):
318    """
319    Protocol for data serialization and deserialization.
320
321    Provides consistent interface for converting between
322    Python objects and wire formats.
323    """
324
325    @abstractmethod
326    def serialize(self, data: Any) -> bytes:
327        """
328        Serialize data to bytes.
329
330        Parameters
331        ----------
332        data : Any
333            Data to serialize
334
335        Returns
336        -------
337        bytes
338            Serialized data
339        """
340        pass
341
342    @abstractmethod
343    def deserialize(self, data: bytes) -> Any:
344        """
345        Deserialize bytes to data.
346
347        Parameters
348        ----------
349        data : bytes
350            Data to deserialize
351
352        Returns
353        -------
354        Any
355            Deserialized data
356        """
357        pass
358
359    @abstractmethod
360    def get_content_type(self) -> str:
361        """
362        Get serialization content type.
363
364        Returns
365        -------
366        str
367            Content type identifier
368        """
369        pass
370
371    @abstractmethod
372    def supports_streaming(self) -> bool:
373        """
374        Check if serializer supports streaming.
375
376        Returns
377        -------
378        bool
379            True if streaming supported
380        """
381        pass
382
383
384class ErrorHandlerProtocol(ABC):
385    """
386    Protocol for error handling and recovery.
387
388    Defines how errors are handled, logged, and recovered
389    from in communication systems.
390    """
391
392    @abstractmethod
393    async def handle_error(self, error: Exception, context: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
394        """
395        Handle communication error.
396
397        Parameters
398        ----------
399        error : Exception
400            Error that occurred
401        context : Dict[str, Any]
402            Error context information
403
404        Returns
405        -------
406        bool
407            True if error was handled and recovery attempted
408        """
409        pass
410
411    @abstractmethod
412    def should_retry(self, error: Exception, retry_count: int) -> bool:
413        """
414        Determine if operation should be retried.
415
416        Parameters
417        ----------
418        error : Exception
419            Error that occurred
420        retry_count : int
421            Current retry count
422
423        Returns
424        -------
425        bool
426            True if should retry
427        """
428        pass
429
430    @abstractmethod
431    def get_retry_delay(self, retry_count: int) -> float:
432        """
433        Get delay before retry.
434
435        Parameters
436        ----------
437        retry_count : int
438            Current retry count
439
440        Returns
441        -------
442        float
443            Delay in seconds
444        """
445        pass
446
447    @abstractmethod
448    def log_error(self, error: Exception, context: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
449        """
450        Log error with context.
451
452        Parameters
453        ----------
454        error : Exception
455            Error to log
456        context : Dict[str, Any]
457            Error context
458        """
459        pass
460
461
462class StreamingProtocol(ABC):
463    """
464    Protocol for streaming data interfaces.
465
466    Defines interface for continuous data streaming
467    with flow control and buffering.
468    """
469
470    @abstractmethod
471    async def start_stream(self, config: Dict[str, Any]) -> str:
472        """
473        Start data stream.
474
475        Parameters
476        ----------
477        config : Dict[str, Any]
478            Stream configuration
479
480        Returns
481        -------
482        str
483            Stream identifier
484        """
485        pass
486
487    @abstractmethod
488    async def stop_stream(self, stream_id: str) -> bool:
489        """
490        Stop data stream.
491
492        Parameters
493        ----------
494        stream_id : str
495            Stream to stop
496
497        Returns
498        -------
499        bool
500            True if successful
501        """
502        pass
503
504    @abstractmethod
505    async def read_stream(self, stream_id: str, count: Optional[int] = None) -> AsyncIterator[Any]:
506        """
507        Read from data stream.
508
509        Parameters
510        ----------
511        stream_id : str
512            Stream to read from
513        count : int, optional
514            Maximum number of items to read
515
516        Yields
517        ------
518        Any
519            Stream data items
520        """
521        pass
522
523    @abstractmethod
524    async def write_stream(self, stream_id: str, data: Any) -> bool:
525        """
526        Write to data stream.
527
528        Parameters
529        ----------
530        stream_id : str
531            Stream to write to
532        data : Any
533            Data to write
534
535        Returns
536        -------
537        bool
538            True if successful
539        """
540        pass
541
542    @abstractmethod
543    def get_stream_stats(self, stream_id: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
544        """
545        Get stream statistics.
546
547        Parameters
548        ----------
549        stream_id : str
550            Stream identifier
551
552        Returns
553        -------
554        Dict[str, Any]
555            Stream statistics
556        """
557        pass
558
559
560class DeviceProtocol(ABC):
561    """
562    Protocol for hardware device interfaces.
563
564    Defines consistent interface for interacting with
565    physical devices and hardware components.
566    """
567
568    @abstractmethod
569    async def initialize_device(self, config: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
570        """
571        Initialize device with configuration.
572
573        Parameters
574        ----------
575        config : Dict[str, Any]
576            Device configuration
577
578        Returns
579        -------
580        bool
581            True if initialization successful
582        """
583        pass
584
585    @abstractmethod
586    async def read_from_device(self, register: str, count: int = 1) -> Any:
587        """
588        Read data from device.
589
590        Parameters
591        ----------
592        register : str
593            Device register or address
594        count : int
595            Number of values to read
596
597        Returns
598        -------
599        Any
600            Read data
601        """
602        pass
603
604    @abstractmethod
605    async def write_to_device(self, register: str, value: Any) -> bool:
606        """
607        Write data to device.
608
609        Parameters
610        ----------
611        register : str
612            Device register or address
613        value : Any
614            Value to write
615
616        Returns
617        -------
618        bool
619            True if successful
620        """
621        pass
622
623    @abstractmethod
624    def get_device_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
625        """
626        Get device information.
627
628        Returns
629        -------
630        Dict[str, Any]
631            Device information
632        """
633        pass
634
635    @abstractmethod
636    async def device_health_check(self) -> bool:
637        """
638        Check device health status.
639
640        Returns
641        -------
642        bool
643            True if device is healthy
644        """
645        pass
646
647    @abstractmethod
648    async def reset_device(self) -> bool:
649        """
650        Reset device to initial state.
651
652        Returns
653        -------
654        bool
655            True if reset successful
656        """
657        pass

CommunicationProtocol¶

Inherits from: ABC

Abstract base protocol for all communication interfaces.

This protocol defines the core interface that all communication systems must implement, providing consistency across different transport mechanisms.

Source Code¶

 1class CommunicationProtocol(ABC):
 2    """
 3    Abstract base protocol for all communication interfaces.
 4
 5    This protocol defines the core interface that all communication
 6    systems must implement, providing consistency across different
 7    transport mechanisms.
 8    """
 9
10    @abstractmethod
11    async def connect(self, config: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
12        """
13        Establish connection with the remote endpoint.
14
15        Parameters
16        ----------
17        config : Dict[str, Any]
18            Connection configuration parameters
19
20        Returns
21        -------
22        bool
23            True if connection successful, False otherwise
24        """
25        pass
26
27    @abstractmethod
28    async def disconnect(self) -> bool:
29        """
30        Close connection gracefully.
31
32        Returns
33        -------
34        bool
35            True if disconnection successful, False otherwise
36        """
37        pass
38
39    @abstractmethod
40    async def send(self, data: Any, metadata: Optional[MessageMetadata] = None) -> bool:
41        """
42        Send data to the remote endpoint.
43
44        Parameters
45        ----------
46        data : Any
47            Data to send
48        metadata : MessageMetadata, optional
49            Message metadata for tracking and routing
50
51        Returns
52        -------
53        bool
54            True if send successful, False otherwise
55        """
56        pass
57
58    @abstractmethod
59    async def receive(self, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[Tuple[Any, MessageMetadata]]:
60        """
61        Receive data from the remote endpoint.
62
63        Parameters
64        ----------
65        timeout : float, optional
66            Timeout in seconds, None for blocking
67
68        Returns
69        -------
70        Tuple[Any, MessageMetadata] or None
71            Received data and metadata, or None if timeout/error
72        """
73        pass
74
75    @abstractmethod
76    def get_connection_state(self) -> ConnectionState:
77        """Get current connection state."""
78        pass
79
80    @abstractmethod
81    def get_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
82        """Get communication statistics."""
83        pass

MessageProtocol¶

Inherits from: ABC

Protocol for message handling and routing.

Defines how messages are processed, routed, and handled within the communication system.

Source Code¶

 1class MessageProtocol(ABC):
 2    """
 3    Protocol for message handling and routing.
 4
 5    Defines how messages are processed, routed, and handled
 6    within the communication system.
 7    """
 8
 9    @abstractmethod
10    async def process_message(self, data: Any, metadata: MessageMetadata) -> Optional[Any]:
11        """
12        Process incoming message.
13
14        Parameters
15        ----------
16        data : Any
17            Message data
18        metadata : MessageMetadata
19            Message metadata
20
21        Returns
22        -------
23        Any or None
24            Response data or None
25        """
26        pass
27
28    @abstractmethod
29    def register_handler(self, message_type: MessageType, handler: Callable) -> None:
30        """
31        Register message handler for specific message type.
32
33        Parameters
34        ----------
35        message_type : MessageType
36            Type of message to handle
37        handler : Callable
38            Handler function
39        """
40        pass
41
42    @abstractmethod
43    def unregister_handler(self, message_type: MessageType) -> None:
44        """
45        Unregister message handler.
46
47        Parameters
48        ----------
49        message_type : MessageType
50            Type of message to stop handling
51        """
52        pass
53
54    @abstractmethod
55    async def route_message(self, data: Any, metadata: MessageMetadata, destination: str) -> bool:
56        """
57        Route message to specific destination.
58
59        Parameters
60        ----------
61        data : Any
62            Message data
63        metadata : MessageMetadata
64            Message metadata
65        destination : str
66            Target destination
67
68        Returns
69        -------
70        bool
71            True if routing successful
72        """
73        pass

Register message handler for specific message type.

View full source →

unregister_handler(self, message_type)¶

Unregister message handler.

View full source →

route_message(self, data, metadata, destination)¶

Route message to specific destination.

View full source →

ConnectionProtocol¶

Inherits from: ABC

Protocol for connection management.

Defines connection lifecycle management, including establishment, maintenance, and cleanup.

Source Code¶

 1class ConnectionProtocol(ABC):
 2    """
 3    Protocol for connection management.
 4
 5    Defines connection lifecycle management, including
 6    establishment, maintenance, and cleanup.
 7    """
 8
 9    @abstractmethod
10    async def establish_connection(self, endpoint: str, config: Dict[str, Any]) -> str:
11        """
12        Establish new connection.
13
14        Parameters
15        ----------
16        endpoint : str
17            Remote endpoint identifier
18        config : Dict[str, Any]
19            Connection configuration
20
21        Returns
22        -------
23        str
24            Connection identifier
25        """
26        pass
27
28    @abstractmethod
29    async def close_connection(self, connection_id: str) -> bool:
30        """
31        Close specific connection.
32
33        Parameters
34        ----------
35        connection_id : str
36            Connection to close
37
38        Returns
39        -------
40        bool
41            True if successful
42        """
43        pass
44
45    @abstractmethod
46    def get_connection_info(self, connection_id: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
47        """
48        Get connection information.
49
50        Parameters
51        ----------
52        connection_id : str
53            Connection identifier
54
55        Returns
56        -------
57        Dict[str, Any] or None
58            Connection information or None if not found
59        """
60        pass
61
62    @abstractmethod
63    def list_connections(self) -> List[str]:
64        """
65        List all active connections.
66
67        Returns
68        -------
69        List[str]
70            List of connection identifiers
71        """
72        pass
73
74    @abstractmethod
75    async def health_check(self, connection_id: str) -> bool:
76        """
77        Check connection health.
78
79        Parameters
80        ----------
81        connection_id : str
82            Connection to check
83
84        Returns
85        -------
86        bool
87            True if healthy
88        """
89        pass

SerializationProtocol¶

Inherits from: ABC

Protocol for data serialization and deserialization.

Provides consistent interface for converting between Python objects and wire formats.

Source Code¶

 1class SerializationProtocol(ABC):
 2    """
 3    Protocol for data serialization and deserialization.
 4
 5    Provides consistent interface for converting between
 6    Python objects and wire formats.
 7    """
 8
 9    @abstractmethod
10    def serialize(self, data: Any) -> bytes:
11        """
12        Serialize data to bytes.
13
14        Parameters
15        ----------
16        data : Any
17            Data to serialize
18
19        Returns
20        -------
21        bytes
22            Serialized data
23        """
24        pass
25
26    @abstractmethod
27    def deserialize(self, data: bytes) -> Any:
28        """
29        Deserialize bytes to data.
30
31        Parameters
32        ----------
33        data : bytes
34            Data to deserialize
35
36        Returns
37        -------
38        Any
39            Deserialized data
40        """
41        pass
42
43    @abstractmethod
44    def get_content_type(self) -> str:
45        """
46        Get serialization content type.
47
48        Returns
49        -------
50        str
51            Content type identifier
52        """
53        pass
54
55    @abstractmethod
56    def supports_streaming(self) -> bool:
57        """
58        Check if serializer supports streaming.
59
60        Returns
61        -------
62        bool
63            True if streaming supported
64        """
65        pass

ErrorHandlerProtocol¶

Inherits from: ABC

Protocol for error handling and recovery.

Defines how errors are handled, logged, and recovered from in communication systems.

Source Code¶

 1class ErrorHandlerProtocol(ABC):
 2    """
 3    Protocol for error handling and recovery.
 4
 5    Defines how errors are handled, logged, and recovered
 6    from in communication systems.
 7    """
 8
 9    @abstractmethod
10    async def handle_error(self, error: Exception, context: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
11        """
12        Handle communication error.
13
14        Parameters
15        ----------
16        error : Exception
17            Error that occurred
18        context : Dict[str, Any]
19            Error context information
20
21        Returns
22        -------
23        bool
24            True if error was handled and recovery attempted
25        """
26        pass
27
28    @abstractmethod
29    def should_retry(self, error: Exception, retry_count: int) -> bool:
30        """
31        Determine if operation should be retried.
32
33        Parameters
34        ----------
35        error : Exception
36            Error that occurred
37        retry_count : int
38            Current retry count
39
40        Returns
41        -------
42        bool
43            True if should retry
44        """
45        pass
46
47    @abstractmethod
48    def get_retry_delay(self, retry_count: int) -> float:
49        """
50        Get delay before retry.
51
52        Parameters
53        ----------
54        retry_count : int
55            Current retry count
56
57        Returns
58        -------
59        float
60            Delay in seconds
61        """
62        pass
63
64    @abstractmethod
65    def log_error(self, error: Exception, context: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
66        """
67        Log error with context.
68
69        Parameters
70        ----------
71        error : Exception
72            Error to log
73        context : Dict[str, Any]
74            Error context
75        """
76        pass

Methods (4)¶

Handle communication error.

View full source →

should_retry(self, error, retry_count)¶

Determine if operation should be retried.

View full source →

get_retry_delay(self, retry_count)¶

Get delay before retry.

View full source →

log_error(self, error, context)¶

Log error with context.

View full source →

StreamingProtocol¶

Inherits from: ABC

Protocol for streaming data interfaces.

Defines interface for continuous data streaming with flow control and buffering.

Source Code¶

 1class StreamingProtocol(ABC):
 2    """
 3    Protocol for streaming data interfaces.
 4
 5    Defines interface for continuous data streaming
 6    with flow control and buffering.
 7    """
 8
 9    @abstractmethod
10    async def start_stream(self, config: Dict[str, Any]) -> str:
11        """
12        Start data stream.
13
14        Parameters
15        ----------
16        config : Dict[str, Any]
17            Stream configuration
18
19        Returns
20        -------
21        str
22            Stream identifier
23        """
24        pass
25
26    @abstractmethod
27    async def stop_stream(self, stream_id: str) -> bool:
28        """
29        Stop data stream.
30
31        Parameters
32        ----------
33        stream_id : str
34            Stream to stop
35
36        Returns
37        -------
38        bool
39            True if successful
40        """
41        pass
42
43    @abstractmethod
44    async def read_stream(self, stream_id: str, count: Optional[int] = None) -> AsyncIterator[Any]:
45        """
46        Read from data stream.
47
48        Parameters
49        ----------
50        stream_id : str
51            Stream to read from
52        count : int, optional
53            Maximum number of items to read
54
55        Yields
56        ------
57        Any
58            Stream data items
59        """
60        pass
61
62    @abstractmethod
63    async def write_stream(self, stream_id: str, data: Any) -> bool:
64        """
65        Write to data stream.
66
67        Parameters
68        ----------
69        stream_id : str
70            Stream to write to
71        data : Any
72            Data to write
73
74        Returns
75        -------
76        bool
77            True if successful
78        """
79        pass
80
81    @abstractmethod
82    def get_stream_stats(self, stream_id: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
83        """
84        Get stream statistics.
85
86        Parameters
87        ----------
88        stream_id : str
89            Stream identifier
90
91        Returns
92        -------
93        Dict[str, Any]
94            Stream statistics
95        """
96        pass

DeviceProtocol¶

Inherits from: ABC

Protocol for hardware device interfaces.

Defines consistent interface for interacting with physical devices and hardware components.

Source Code¶

 1class DeviceProtocol(ABC):
 2    """
 3    Protocol for hardware device interfaces.
 4
 5    Defines consistent interface for interacting with
 6    physical devices and hardware components.
 7    """
 8
 9    @abstractmethod
10    async def initialize_device(self, config: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
11        """
12        Initialize device with configuration.
13
14        Parameters
15        ----------
16        config : Dict[str, Any]
17            Device configuration
18
19        Returns
20        -------
21        bool
22            True if initialization successful
23        """
24        pass
25
26    @abstractmethod
27    async def read_from_device(self, register: str, count: int = 1) -> Any:
28        """
29        Read data from device.
30
31        Parameters
32        ----------
33        register : str
34            Device register or address
35        count : int
36            Number of values to read
37
38        Returns
39        -------
40        Any
41            Read data
42        """
43        pass
44
45    @abstractmethod
46    async def write_to_device(self, register: str, value: Any) -> bool:
47        """
48        Write data to device.
49
50        Parameters
51        ----------
52        register : str
53            Device register or address
54        value : Any
55            Value to write
56
57        Returns
58        -------
59        bool
60            True if successful
61        """
62        pass
63
64    @abstractmethod
65    def get_device_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
66        """
67        Get device information.
68
69        Returns
70        -------
71        Dict[str, Any]
72            Device information
73        """
74        pass
75
76    @abstractmethod
77    async def device_health_check(self) -> bool:
78        """
79        Check device health status.
80
81        Returns
82        -------
83        bool
84            True if device is healthy
85        """
86        pass
87
88    @abstractmethod
89    async def reset_device(self) -> bool:
90        """
91        Reset device to initial state.
92
93        Returns
94        -------
95        bool
96            True if reset successful
97        """
98        pass
